flc.lambdactor.core

Interface IGreenThrFactory

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GreenThr_single, GreenThr_zero, GreenThrFactory_single

    public interface IGreenThrFactory
extends java.io.Closeable
    Green thread factory

    Generate green threads needed by actors. 

     Example usage pattern:

 
    java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<Integer>
        future = new java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<>();
    try (IGreenThrFactory f = new A_factory_implementation(..))
    {
        //Actor usage:
        new A(..)     // A: your actor implementation
            .init(f)  // IActorRef<A>
            .send(a -> {
                //call method(s) on instance 'a'
            });
        //Thread usage:
        f.newThread().execute(() -> {
            //do some work..  value = ...
            future.complete(value);
        });
    }
    int final_result = future.get(); //wait
    Date: 27.07.13
    See Also:
    ActorBase

    • Method Detail

      • await

        void await(long millis)
    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits at most millis milliseconds for threads to terminate. A timeout of 0 means to wait forever. Use with care: Don't call from tasks running in child threads (created with newThread()) , including actors using this factory, or the method can deadlock. Before or while calling, be sure that shutdown() or shutdownNow() is called.

        (Typically implemented by calling java.lang.Thread.join() or java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService.awaitTermination())

        Parameters:
        millis - the time to wait in milliseconds
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value of millis is negative
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if any thread has interrupted the current thread. The interrupted status of the current thread is cleared when this exception is thrown.

      • close

        default void close()
        Prepare for shutdown of associated threads. Default action is to stop all associated threads when there is no more work. If already closed then invoking this method has no effect.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable

      • newThread

        IGreenThr newThread()
        Create a new green thread.
        Returns:
        thread

      • setActiveListener

        void setActiveListener(java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Boolean> listener)
        Set listener to be called each time threads changes active/non-active state.

        Active = true: at least one thread have remaining work

        Passive = false: all threads have processed all messages

        Parameters:
        listener - called when active state changes

      • setEmptyListener

        default void setEmptyListener(java.lang.Runnable listener)
        Set empty listener to be called when all threads of this factory becomes inactive. Default implementation is based on setActiveListener(Consumer).
        Parameters:
        listener - called when done (empty message queues)

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()

        Initiates an orderly shutdown in which previously submitted tasks are executed, but no new tasks will be accepted. Invocation has no additional effect if already shut down.

        This method does not wait for previously submitted tasks to complete execution. Use await(long) to do that.

        (Behaviour based on ExecutorService.shutdown())

      • shutdownNow

        void shutdownNow()
        Attempts to stop all actively executing tasks, halts the processing of waiting tasks.

        This method does not wait for actively executing tasks to terminate. Use await(long) to do that.

        There are no guarantees beyond best-effort attempts to stop processing actively executing tasks. For example, typical implementations will cancel via Thread.interrupt(), so any task that fails to respond to interrupts may never terminate.

        (Behaviour based on ExecutorService.shutdownNow())
